skill.name: AgentDB Vector Search
skill.description: Implement semantic vector search with AgentDB for intelligent document retrieval, similarity matching, and context-aware querying. Use when building RAG systems, semantic search engines, or intelligent knowledge bases.
skill.summary: Implement semantic vector search with AgentDB for intelligent document retrieval, similarity matchin...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides instructions for using AgentDB vector search. No executable code, network calls, or file system access beyond documentation reading. The skill teaches users how to implement vector search but contains no actual implementation code itself.

content.user_title: Implement lightning-fast vector search with AgentDB
content.value_statement: Traditional vector databases are slow and memory-intensive. AgentDB delivers 150x faster semantic search with sub-millisecond query times and 4-32x memory reduction through advanced quantization.
actual_capabilities: Sub-millisecond vector search (<100¬µs) with HNSW indexing
4-32x memory reduction through binary, scalar, and product quantization
Support for multiple distance metrics (cosine, euclidean, dot product)
Batch operations for 500x faster bulk inserts
MMR (Maximal Marginal Relevance) for diverse search results
limitations: Requires Node.js 18+ and AgentDB v1.0.7+ installation
Needs OpenAI API key or custom embedding model for text vectorization
Database files must be locally accessible (no remote DB support)
Vector dimensions must match embedding model (1536 for OpenAI ada-002)

use_cases.title: Retrieval Augmented Generation
use_cases.description: Build RAG pipelines that retrieve relevant context from vector databases to enhance LLM responses with domain-specific knowledge.

use_cases.title: Intelligent Document Search
use_cases.description: Replace keyword search with semantic understanding to find relevant documents based on meaning rather than exact word matches.

use_cases.title: Semantic Product Search
use_cases.description: Power recommendation engines and similarity matching for products, content, or users in your AI-powered application.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Vector Search
prompt_templates.scenario: Store and search documents by similarity
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me set up AgentDB vector search to store 1000 documents with OpenAI embeddings and find the most similar ones to a query about machine learning.

prompt_templates.title: RAG System Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a RAG pipeline using AgentDB that retrieves relevant technical documentation and generates answers to user questions about our API.

prompt_templates.title: Performance Optimization
prompt_templates.scenario: Optimize search speed and memory usage
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure AgentDB with binary quantization and HNSW indexing for 100k vectors to achieve sub-100¬µs search times with minimal memory usage.

prompt_templates.title: Hybrid Search Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement hybrid search that finds similar products by vector similarity but filters by category='electronics' and price range in metadata.

output_examples.input: Search for documents about quantum computing

best_practices: Use binary quantization for 32x memory reduction when approximate results are acceptable
Set similarity threshold to 0.7-0.8 for quality results, adjust based on your specific use case
Enable MMR (Maximal Marginal Relevance) to avoid redundant results and improve diversity
anti_patterns: Do not use exact dimensions from examples without checking your embedding model's actual output size
Avoid storing raw vectors without quantization in production - this wastes 4-32x more memory
Never skip similarity threshold tuning - default values may return too many or too few results

faq.question: Is AgentDB compatible with my existing embedding models?
faq.answer: Yes, AgentDB works with any embedding model. Just ensure the vector dimensions match when initializing the database (1536 for OpenAI, 768 for sentence-transformers, etc).

faq.question: What are the limits on vector database size?
faq.answer: AgentDB efficiently handles 1M+ vectors. For larger datasets, use quantization to reduce memory usage and consider sharding across multiple database files.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing Node.js application?
faq.answer: Yes, install the agentic-flow package and use the TypeScript/JavaScript API. The skill provides complete code examples for integration.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using vector search?
faq.answer: All vectors are stored locally in your database file. No data is sent to external services during search operations, ensuring complete privacy.

faq.question: Search is returning irrelevant results, how do I fix this?
faq.answer: Adjust the similarity threshold (try 0.8+), ensure embeddings are from the same model, and consider using MMR for more diverse, relevant results.

faq.question: How does AgentDB compare to Pinecone or Weaviate?
faq.answer: AgentDB offers 150x faster performance with sub-millisecond latency, runs locally without API costs, and provides advanced quantization for superior memory efficiency.
